kickstart.description: Put support files on a Rocks frontend that enables building EC2-compatible VMs
kickstart.post:
# # now ec2 roll uses local image kernel with PV_grub # http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/UserProvidedkernels.html # #/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_kernel value=None #/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_kernelTar value=None #/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_kernelVersion value=None #/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_initrd value=None # this is PV-GRUB for US-East-1 From User Guide for Linux (API Version 2014-09-01) # can find listing via command # ec2-describe-images -o amazon --filter "name=pv-grub-*.gz"
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_aki_i386 value=aki-8f9dcae6 /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr ec2_aki_x86_64 value=aki-919dcaf8
# Add the ec2-dynamic appliance type. This is a convenient moniker to # do special things to appliances running in ec2 /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance ec2-dynamic membership="EC2 Dynamic Host" compute=no public=yes /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr ec2-dynamic managed value=true /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr ec2-dynamic os value=linux /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr ec2-dynamic primary_net value=ec2private
# Set up the default tunnel parameters, roles for clients and frontends /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr vtunListenPort value=6161 /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr vtunServer value=&Kickstart_PublicHostname; /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr ec2-dynamic vtunRole value=client /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr ec2-dynamic vtunListenNet value=ec2private /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr frontend vtunListenNet value=public /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr frontend vtunRole value=server
# Override the global default route. This is for the case of # rocks sync host network ec2-dynamic, the DHCP'ed default route remains
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance route ec2-dynamic 0.0.0.0 netmask=255.255.255.255 &Kickstart_PrivateAddress; /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance route ec2-dynamic 224.0.0.0 netmask=255.255.255.0 ec2tunnel /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance route ec2-dynamic 255.255.255.255 netmask=255.255.255.255 ec2private
# Enable ec2 by default for the devel-server appliance /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr devel-server ec2_enable value=true
# Create some networking holders. These are just netmasks. but useful /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add network ec2public 0.0.0.0 netmask=255.255.255.255 mtu=1500 dnszone=compute-1.amazonaws.com servedns=false /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add network ec2private 0.0.0.0 netmask=255.255.254.0 mtu=1500 servedns=false /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add network ec2tunnel 0.0.0.0 netmask=255.255.255.252 mtu=1500
